abstract: Assuming the success of the Kindle partly accounts for Amazon’s crazy stock price, there may be a way to assess its value.
snippet: Assuming the success of the Kindle partly accounts for Amazon’s crazy stock price, there may be a way to assess its value.
lead_paragraph: Amazon.com’s hand-held electronic reading gadget, the Kindle, is selling like hot cakes. It sold out over Christmas. Those available secondhand are going for up to twice the $360 retail price. Assuming the success of the Kindle partly accounts for Amazon’s crazy stock price, there may be a way to assess its value.

headline.main: What’s the Kindle Worth to Amazon?
headline.print_headline: What’s the Kindle Worth to Amazon?

byline.original: By Jeff Segal, Rob Cox and Robert Cyran
